item.title: This Is How Much Money You Saved on Games With PS Plus Essential in 2025
item.description:
Year-round PlayStation Plus subscribers received substantial value from their memberships in 2025, with the combined retail value of free games offered by Sony exceeding $1,500. While that figure represents a minor decrease from 2024, the total number of free titles on PS Plus has actually increased over the past 12 months, if only marginally.

Monthly free games are far from the only benefit of PS Plus, but they are among its highlights, not least because they are available on every tier of the service: Essential, Extra, and Premium. Sony typically averages three new freebies—which, after being claimed, remain playable for as long as one is subscribed—per month, but the company deviated from this pattern several times over the course of 2025.

PS Plus Gave Away Over $1,500 Worth of Games in 2025

PS Plus offered 39 monthly free games in 2025, one more than the year before, averaging 3.25 titles per month. That figure was driven largely by two months: June, when PS Plus subscribers could claim Destiny 2 's The Final Shape expansion alongside three other freebies, and December, which featured five free titles, all of which remain available to claim until early January. Based on full retail prices, the total value of the 2025 lineup reached $1,536.61, representing a roughly 4% decline compared to 2024.

PS Plus Free Game Stats for 2025

  • Total games given away : 39 (+2.63% YoY)
    • Monthly average: 3.25 games
    • Cross-gen games: 20 (-40% YoY)
    • PS5-only games: 19 (+280% YoY)

  • Total value : $1,536.61 (-3.94% YoY)
    • Monthly average: $128.05 worth of games

  • Average game price : $39.40 (-6.41% YoY)

One notable trend observed in this year's data is a sharp decline in PS4 games. In 2024, nearly 87% of all monthly free titles claimable by PS Plus Essential, Extra, and Premium subscribers were playable on Sony's last-generation console. This year, that percentage dropped to 51.28%. The trend is expected to continue, with Sony previously confirming plans to further deprioritize PS4 titles within PS Plus benefits starting in January 2026.

With PS Plus Essential priced between $79.99 and $119.88 per year (based on one- and 12-month plans), the more than $1,530 worth of free titles offered in 2025 represents a significant cost advantage. Actual value will vary based on player preference, but from a pure cost-savings perspective, the Essential tier delivered solid returns over the course of this year.

More PS Plus News Is Coming Before Year's End

The latest batch of PS Plus freebies that went live in early December 2025 is still available to claim until January 5. Its standout title is Neon White , a speedrunning-centric shooter that's one of the highest-rated games released in 2022. The January 2026 freebies are expected to be announced on December 31, aligning with Sony's usual pattern of revealing them on the last Wednesday of the month.

item.title: 10 Best Open-World Games If You Want To Live Off The Land
item.description:
Open-world games strive to make their vast environs feel real, to draw players in and convince them that they're actually living in a fantastical realm, unlike anything the real world can offer. Some games choose to do this in a particularly demanding way by introducing survival mechanics, forcing players to engage with the world on a deeper level as they struggle for what they need to survive.

Open-world games that make players live off the land typically have a much higher degree of player interaction, as fans struggle not only to complete story and gameplay goals but to gather the resources they need to stay alive. Here are ten open-world games with survival elements to up the challenge and engagement.

10 Red Dead Redemption 2

Life On The Frontier

Red Dead Redemption 2
10 /10
Released
October 26, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Developer(s)
Rockstar Games
Genre(s)
Action, Adventure
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC, Stadia
Powered by

Red Dead Redemption 2 's survival mechanics are rather light compared to some other games in the genre, but the title's well-known emphasis on detail and realism still makes these features worth paying attention to. Fans who want to keep Arthur's performance as strong as possible should play close attention to his hunger levels. They should also monitor the temperature and make sure he's dressed appropriately for his environment.

Neglecting these survival elements won't have severe repercussions, especially when compared to more intense survival games, but the gameplay benefits fans will get from keeping Arthur comfortable and well-fed are enough to incentivize keeping track of them. This in turn keeps players immersed in Rockstar's incredibly detailed open-world.

9 Fallout: New Vegas

The Long Road To Vegas

Fallout: New Vegas
8 /10
Released
October 19, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Developer(s)
Obsidian Entertainment
Genre(s)
RPG
Platform(s)
PS3, Xbox 360, PC
Powered by

Fallout: New Vegas presents a rich and immersive post-apocalyptic desert realm, and fans who invest in the Survival skill can gather ingredients from every corner of this bleak wasteland and create beneficial and nourishing healing items. Fans who really want to put their survival skills to the test can turn on the optional Hardcore mode, which makes the Mojave Wasteland much more punishing.

Hardcore mode introduces several gameplay challenges to up the ante, such as making healing and support items less immediately effective and making it possible for companions to permanently die. The most noticeable changes, however, come from the introduction of mechanics measuring food, drink, and sleep. If players don't stay nourished, hydrated, and well-rested, they risk immediate death. This mode is the ultimate survival challenge for Fallout fans who want to live off the land.

8 Palworld

Building A Life For Your Pals

Palworld
Released
January 19, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Violence
Developer(s)
Pocket Pair, Inc.
Genre(s)
Open-World, Shooter, Survival
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series S, Xbox Series X
Powered by

Much has been made of Palworld 's remarkable similarity to the Pokemon franchise, but in terms of gameplay, the title does stand on its own. This open-world game tasks fans with building a base and taming various creatures to aid in their survival.

As they work on taming their creatures, fans must also manage their own hunger levels, ensuring that they're well-equipped and well-prepared to survive in this hostile open world. Players who are interested in a survival experience might enjoy keeping both themselves and their Pals alive in this extensive game.

7 The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild

Not About Surviving, But About Making The Most Of Limited Resources

The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild
10 /10
Released
March 3, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E for Everyone: Fantasy Violence, Use of Alcohol, Mild Suggestive Themes
Developer(s)
Nintendo EPD
Genre(s)
Action, Adventure
Platform(s)
Nintendo Wii U, Switch
Powered by

The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild was one of the standout open-world games of the 2010s, and recommending it is almost cliché by this point. Nevertheless, Nintendo's masterpiece advises you to live off the land, albeit not in the traditional survival way. Technically, Link does not need to pick up food, cook, find different types of clothing, amass an arsenal of weapons, or explore every nook and cranny of Hyrule; however, if he wants to get far, he will need to dedicate time to all of those.

Unlike open-world games that use food to maintain basic needs, BOTW 's recipes provide boosts that aid in combat or exploration, providing things like more stamina and health, or protection against the cold. Link will not only need to acquire the required ingredients, but he also needs to prepare meals that he can keep in his back pocket for when he needs them. The same goes for weapons, as you will be constantly picking up new clubs and swords to ensure you are never caught empty-handed.

6 Subnautica

Under The Sea

Subnautica
Released
January 23, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ for Everyone 10+: Fantasy Violence, Mild Language
Genre(s)
Survival, Horror
Powered by

Subnautica stands out from the crowd of survival crafting games on the back of its unique setting. The game strands players on an alien world almost entirely covered in ocean, tasking them with survival in a realm without dry land.

Players of Subnautica will have to make use of whatever they can find under the waves in order to stay alive in this beautiful and terrifying alien sea. In addition to food and shelter, fans will need to contend with the menacing leviathans that prowl the depths as they struggle to stay alive.

5 Minecraft

The World Is Yours

Minecraft
Released
November 18, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence
Developer(s)
Mojang
Genre(s)
Sandbox, Survival
Platform(s)
3DS, Android, iOS, Nintendo Switch, Nintendo Wii U, PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, PS Vita, Xbox One, Xbox 360
6 Images
Powered by

Minecraft needs no introduction. This titanic game gives fans a world the size of a planet to explore, and gives them the freedom to travel and build wherever and whatever their hearts desire. In terms of raw, unrestricted freedom, there are almost no games that can hold a candle to Minecraft .

In order to last in survival mode, fans will have to gather the resources to become self-sufficient. High-level players can use Redstone to build automated farms, ensuring a constant stream of nutrients and resources, and underground dungeons can yield valuable finds like melon seeds to further increase survivability against the countless threats prowling the night in Minecraft .

Shout out to Vintage Story , which is hardcore Minecraft .

4 Conan Exiles

Heroes Of The Hyborian Age

Conan Exiles
Survival
Action-Adventure
Systems
Released
May 8, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Language, Nudity, Use of Alcohol
Developer(s)
Funcom
Genre(s)
Survival, Action-Adventure
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

This multiplayer survival game brings players to the legendary realm of Conan the Barbarian, tasking them with survival in the inhospitable wastes. Fans will have to go to extreme lengths to stay alive, fending off mythical beasts, hostile players, and the ever-present threat of starvation.

If players can keep themselves alive long enough, they can grow to prosper in this cruel world, building elaborate settlements and establishing factions to rule over the wastes. A successful Conan Exiles player can become a mythological figure on par with the legendary barbarian himself.

3 Project Zomboid

Life Among The Dead

Project Zomboid
Released
November 8, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
The Indie Stone
Genre(s)
Survival Horror
Platform(s)
PC
7 Images
Powered by

Project Zomboid takes the well-tread zombie apocalypse premise and gives it an in-depth survival angle. Fans need to not only resist the endless hordes of the undead, but must gather resources and build up a base for themselves, all the while managing their food levels and even finding ways to stave off boredom and stress.

Death is an inevitability in Project Zomboid . Players aren't expected to survive and thrive in this post-apocalyptic world so much as they're tasked with keeping themselves going as long as they can manage. With robust multiplayer offerings and a variety of custom settings to play with in sandbox mode, fans have a lot of options for trying to survive the apocalypse.

2 Valheim

A Viking's Quest

Valheim
Released
February 2, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
r
Genre(s)
Sandbox, Survival
Powered by

The titular realm of Valheim is a sort of purgatory for Viking souls to prove themselves worthy of Odin's court. Fans of the video game must demonstrate their valor by hunting down the mythical beasts that haunt the realm, all while keeping themselves nourished and sheltered against the threats of the world.

Subscribe to the newsletter for survival open-world guides

Dive deeper with the newsletter: subscribe for curated picks, practical survival tips, and thoughtful analysis of survival open-world games and related gaming coverage to inform your next playthrough.

Subscribe to the newsletter for survival open-world guides

Dive deeper with the newsletter: subscribe for curated picks, practical survival tips, and thoughtful analysis of survival open-world games and related gaming coverage to inform your next playthrough.

By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept Valnet’s Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

Players must fish, farm, and forage to stay alive, while also arming themselves against threats like the game's infamous giant trolls. Valheim is an unforgiving realm, but one where true Vikings can thrive.

1 Green Hell

Hard-As-Nails Survival Game With Constant Environmental Threats

Green Hell
Released
September 5, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood, Crude Humor, Strong Language, Use of Drugs, Violence
Developer(s)
Creepy Jar
Genre(s)
Survival
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

While almost all survival games boil down to "living off the land," they differ in their depth, tone, and difficulty. If you want a truly hardcore experience, Green Hell is probably the best option on the market, so much so that I would not recommend the game to genre beginners who are looking to attempt their first survival campaign. Stranded in an Amazonian jungle, you will need to put in the sweat and tears to make it out in one piece, and nothing comes easy. Green Hell aims for realism, requiring players to naturally collect raw materials rather than just discovering loot.

Balance is a big part of Green Hell 's design philosophy, as you are held to tougher standards in order to meet your needs. For instance, food is broken down into things like hydration and proteins, so you cannot just eat whatever you find without consequences. Crafting is also complex and experience-based, opting against the traditional menu system found in most games.

item.title: How to Beat Rocketeer in Arc Raiders (Out of the Shadows)
item.description:
Veteran players know that ARC Raiders ' Rocketeers are, as Shani puts it, "Slow but devastating." No matter how high-tier your gear is or how experienced a raider you are in the Rust Belt, this ARC can take you down in seconds and should always be approached with caution. That said, there is an ARC Raiders quest called Out of the Shadows that forces players to confront this infamous machine.

Whether your goal is to complete the Out of Shadows quest or you are simply trying to farm Rocketeer drivers, this guide has you covered. It breaks down the fastest ways to beat Rocketeers with beginner-level loadouts and offers pro tips to help minimize the danger when taking on this ARC.

  • Rocketeer Overview

    • Danger Level : Very High
    • Armor : Fully Plated Body
    • Attack : Rockets
    • Most Valuable Loot : Driver

Out of the Shadows Quest Info

Quest Giver

Shani

Requirement(s)

Destroy a Rocketeer, retrieve a Rocketeer Driver

Reward(s)

Wolfpack (2), Surge Shield Recharger (3)

Description

Did you see the flags? The time for cowering is over. You've been more than battle-tested, from what I hear; think you can take on a Rocketeer?

How to Take Down a Rocketeer with a Beginner Loadout

Loadout Details

  • Primary weapon : Ferro or Anvil (any level)
  • Quick Use : Hornet Driver
  • Augment : Doesn't matter
  • Healing Items : Shield, Shield Rechargers, Bandages
  • Ammo : Heavy (at least 50 bullets)

To defeat a Rocketeer with beginner gear, start by removing the armor from its thrusters. Once one is exposed, throw a Hornet Driver at it to stun the machine for a few seconds . Use that window to destroy the exposed thruster, then repeat the process on another engine if the first one does not bring it down.

Hornet Drivers can be obtained by killing the ARC with an electrical shock weapon.

The Best Location for Farming Rocketeer Drivers

In ARC Raiders ' Dam Battlegrounds map, there is an area called the Primary Facility , located between the Control Tower and the Water Treatment Control. This high-ground spot is ideal for farming Rocketeers for two reasons: it is close to an extraction point, letting you leave the match as soon as you secure a driver, and it has a high Rocketeer spawn rate, with several nearby structures you can use for cover.

How to Get Rocketeer Drivers without Killing the ARC

During ARC Raiders ' Husk Graveyard event, you can find multiple wrecked Rocketeers, some of which still contain Epic-rarity drivers. If you lack the gear or ammo to take on an active Rocketeer, this map condition is your best option for obtaining Rocketeer Drivers.

If you are trying to complete the Out of the Shadows quest in ARC Raiders , this method will only count toward one of the two objectives, as Shani also requires you to take down a Rocketeer.

Fastest Way to Beat Rocketeer with High-Level Gear

For veteran ARC Raiders players with high-end equipment, Rocketeers are easy to take down. A couple of Wolfpacks or a handful of Sticky Grenades are usually enough to drop the infamous ARC in seconds.

Subscribe to the newsletter for ARC Raiders combat tips

Join the newsletter for focused ARC Raiders coverage—detailed strategies, farming locations, and loadout breakdowns to help you handle Rocketeers and similar ARCs. Subscribe to access more guides and practical tactical tips centered on this game content.

Subscribe to the newsletter for ARC Raiders combat tips

Join the newsletter for focused ARC Raiders coverage—detailed strategies, farming locations, and loadout breakdowns to help you handle Rocketeers and similar ARCs. Subscribe to access more guides and practical tactical tips centered on this game content.

By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept Valnet’s Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

The issue is that most players receive the Out of the Shadows quest early, before they have access to high-tier gear like Wolfpacks. In that case, it is better to rely on more accessible items, such as the Hornet Driver or even the Snap Grenade, which are much easier to obtain.

Tips and Notes for Combating Rocketeers

Keep these points in mind when fighting Rocketeers:

  • Bring Lure Grenades . There may be situations where your gear or positioning is not enough to handle a Rocketeer. In those moments, throwing a Lure Grenade away from your location can distract the ARC and give you a chance to escape.
  • Use the building peek method . Find a structure with two nearby entrances. Shoot the Rocketeer from one side, then quickly rotate and attack from the other angle. This makes it easier to avoid its missiles, as Rocketeers are slow and tend to commit to targeting your initial position.
  • Hold onto your Rocketeer Drivers . You will need them for the Explosives station upgrade in ARC Raiders ' Workbench menu.
10 /10

ARC Raiders

Follow
Followed
Extraction
Shooter
Third-Person Shooter
Survival
Systems

Top Critic Avg: 87 /100 Critics Rec: 92%
Released

Embark Studios

WHERE TO PLAY

Powered by

item.title: Steam is Down Right Now and Having Major Problems on Christmas Eve
item.description:
Unfortunately for the millions of PC gamers that use Steam , Valve's digital platform is experiencing some major issues today. Steam is the premiere digital storefront for PC gamers, boasting the biggest lineup of games from old-school classics to modern-day masterpieces. Steam's many quality-of-life features and consumer-friendly model have made it the go-to for most PC gamers.

Steam is almost always working properly, but there are rare occasions when it has some hiccups. Steam's latest issues cropped up on Christmas Eve, with the platform going down for a brief period of time before coming back up, only to go down again. Right now, it seems Steam is working for some gamers but not others, and it's unclear when exactly the issues will be fully resolved.

Is Steam Down Right Now?

When it comes to accessing Steam on December 24, mileage may vary. At the time of this writing, it's not 100% working for me, but others are apparently able to access it with no problem. Valve itself has not issued a statement on the problems plaguing Steam today, but hopefully the issues are resolved soon.

It's unclear what exactly is causing Steam's issues. It's possible that the influx of people using Steam over the holidays is causing problems, or maybe there's something else at play. Whatever the case may be, we will update this article once Steam services are fully restored for everyone.

Newsletter: Steam outage coverage and platform updates

Subscribe to the newsletter for focused coverage of Steam outages and platform disruptions. You'll get clear reporting and context that explains access issues, potential causes, and the implications for PC gamers — reliable coverage of these platform topics.

item.title: Xbox Game Pass Only Has 2 Games Confirmed for January 2026 So Far
item.description:
At the time of this writing, there are only two new games confirmed to be coming to Xbox Game Pass in January 2026. 2025 was one of the biggest years in Xbox Game Pass history, but it likely left many subscribers with mixed feelings. On one hand, Xbox Game Pass received some of its best games ever in 2025, but on the other hand, Microsoft also increased the price of the Ultimate tier from $19.99 per month to $29.99 per month.

Whether Xbox Game Pass is still worth it or not after the price hike will depend on what exactly you want from it. If you are someone that would otherwise be purchasing the new games added to Xbox Game Pass, then even with the price hike, the service still likely pays for itself. If you are someone that only plays a Game Pass game every once in a while, then you may want to be more selective with the months you are signed up for it. Regardless, there's no denying that Microsoft does make a big effort to ensure that there is a steady pipeline of high-quality games for Game Pass, with even more day one titles on the way to help justify the price increase.

When it comes to the Xbox Game Pass January 2026 lineup, though, a lot of it still remains a mystery. Microsoft will likely reveal more about its Xbox Game Pass January 2026 plans at some point in the next few weeks, but in the meantime, we do know of at least two titles that are on the way. Mio: Memories in Orbit will join Xbox Game Pass on January 20, while Nova Roma will hit the service on January 22.

List of New Xbox Game Pass Games Coming in January 2026

  • Mio: Memories in Orbit - January 20
  • Nova Roma (PC) - January 22

For those unfamiliar with the games, Mio: Memories in Orbit is one of the first notable new game releases of 2026. A sci-fi Metroidvania, Mio has players exploring "an enormous technological ark" filled with deadly machines. In typical Metroidvania fashion, players will have to acquire new upgrades to expand their combat and exploration capabilities as they make their way through the game's visually-striking world. Metroidvania fans should definitely mark their calendars for Mio: Memories in Orbit , and those with a Game Pass Ultimate subscription will be able to play through the game in its entirety without paying anything beyond their normal fee.

Nova Roma , meanwhile, is offering something completely different. Nova Roma is a city-builder where players build a Roman city. Managing the city is one part of the equation, but players also have to deal with Roman gods. Offending the gods can have major consequences, which adds an interesting wrinkle to the city-builder formula. Nova Roma is only confirmed for PC, so Game Pass subscribers on Xbox consoles will need to keep that in mind.

Other Xbox Game Pass Games Coming in 2026

  • MENACE (PC) - February 5
  • High on Life 2 - February 13
  • Death Howl (Xbox Series X) - February 19
  • Replaced - March 12

Besides Mio: Memories in Orbit and Nova Roma , there are only four other Xbox Game Pass games with specific release dates confirmed for 2026 so far. There's MENACE on February 5, High on Life 2 on February 13, Death Howl on February 19, and Replaced on March 12.

MENACE is a sci-fi turn-based tactics game from the developers of Battle Brothers , and it will be launching in early access on February 5 on PC. PC Game Pass and Game Pass Ultimate subscribers will be able to play it on PC that day, but those on consoles will have to wait until some point later on.

The original High on Life was a great day one Xbox Game Pass game, and so it's fitting that the sequel is also debuting as a day one release on the service as well. High on Life 2 will deliver more of the same kind of zany sci-fi first-person shooter action that the first game did, and looks like it will be plenty hilarious. It's one of my most-anticipated Game Pass games of 2026, and I can't wait to play it.

Death Howl is a tough-as-nails deck-building card game that is currently available to PC Game Pass subscribers. Console gamers on Xbox Series X/S will get to see what all the fuss is about for themselves on February 19.

Subscribe for In-Depth Xbox Game Pass Coverage

Dig deeper on Game Pass: subscribe to the newsletter for comprehensive coverage of Xbox Game Pass additions, value analysis for subscribers, and broader gaming coverage that helps you evaluate upcoming titles and platform trends.

Subscribe for In-Depth Xbox Game Pass Coverage

Dig deeper on Game Pass: subscribe to the newsletter for comprehensive coverage of Xbox Game Pass additions, value analysis for subscribers, and broader gaming coverage that helps you evaluate upcoming titles and platform trends.

By subscribing, you agree to receive newsletter and marketing emails, and accept Valnet’s Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. You can unsubscribe anytime.

Finally, Replaced is coming to Xbox Game Pass on March 12. An action-platformer that Game Pass subscribers have been waiting ages for, the long road to Replaced is nearly at an end and if it lives up to the hype, it will undoubtedly be one of the biggest new Game Pass releases of the entire year.

There are many other Game Pass games with TBA 2026 release dates penciled in, including four massive titles from Microsoft itself. Forza Horizon 6 , the Fable reboot, Gears of War: E-Day , and the Halo 1 remake are all planned for 2026 releases as a way to help celebrate Xbox's 25th anniversary. More details on those games and other titles could very well come at the Xbox Developer Direct in January, so stay tuned for more information on that front.
